clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Different Concentrations of Carbamide as Moisturizers in Ichthyosis Vulgaris
clinical_study.official_title: Double Blinded Randomized Clinical Study of Carbamide as Moisturizer in Ichthyosis Vulgaris

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized double blinded clinical trial will be conducted comparing the effect of three simple basic moisturizers only different in the concentration of carbamide (urea). Three concentrations of carbamide will be tested, 5, 7.5, and 10 %, respectively. The study will be conducted as a split-body-study and will contain three arms randomized to comparing 5 and 7.5 %, 5 and 10 %, and 7.5 and 10 % carbamide, respectively. 20-30 patients with at least clinically verified Ichthyosis Vulgaris will be enrolled to each study arm. The effect of the moisturizers will be assessed by clinical examination (score), patients assesment of effect and measurement of transepidermal water loss (TEWL) and other skin parameters.

intervention.intervention_name: Comparing the effect of moisturizers with 5 and 7.5 % carbamide, respectively
intervention.description: Patient untreated with moisturizers for 1-2 weeks will start applying moisturizers containing urea at concentration 5 % on one half of the body twice a day while applying the same moisturizer with 7.5 % urea on the other half of the body in the same quantity at the same frequence
